Author: ùôäùôûùô£ùô†#3612
Content:
`-connect=<ip>`  Connect only to the specified node(s) will greatly improve speed for download entire ~~bootstrap~~ blockchain.
Also you can use these options to speed up the synchronization process.
`-maxconnections=<n>`  Maintain at most <n> connections to peers (default: 384)
`-maxreceivebuffer=<n>`  Maximum per-connection receive buffer, <n>*1000 bytes (default: 5000)
`-maxsendbuffer=<n>`  Maximum per-connection send buffer, <n>*1000 bytes (default: 1000)

Author: ùôäùôûùô£ùô†#3612
Content: I don't think so. I recently synchronized on LAN with my RockPi using `-connect=<IP>` and I had synchronized the entire chain within 2 hours.

Author: ùôäùôûùô£ùô†#3612
Content: Ofcoarse I restarted the deamon for normal operation afterwards, without the `-connect` option

Author: Alright#0419
Content: `-connect` isn't likely to speed it up

Author: Alright#0419
Content: there is a default of how much bandwidth your node will allow to a single peer

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it will hit that and stop for a while

Author: Alright#0419
Content: `-connect=1 -addnode=<IP> -addnode=<another IP> -addnode=<another IP>` should do it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: will basically `-connect=` to those 3(or more) nodes and you'll be less likely to hit that bandwidth limit

Author: ùôäùôûùô£ùô†#3612
Content: On LAN it worked like a charm.. I will try your suggestion, since I think it will be more suitable for the general public.

Author: Alright#0419
Content: if it's on LAN, just bootstrap it
